meanings.definition: mantlings: plural noun - decorative drapery or fabric used to adorn or cover something
meanings.sent1: The mantlings on the curtains added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: She carefully arranged the mantlings on the table for the fancy dinner party.
meanings.sent3: The mantlings on the Christmas tree made it look like a festive forest.
meanings.sent4: Her mantlings of colorful scarves created a vibrant display in the boutique.
meanings.sent5: The mantlings of ivy climbing up the walls gave the garden a magical feel.

meanings.definition: mantlings: verb - to cover or adorn with decorative drapery or fabric
meanings.sent1: He decided to mantlings the chairs with new fabric to give them a fresh look.
meanings.sent2: The tailor mantlingsed the dress with intricate lace patterns.
meanings.sent3: She playfully mantlingsed her dog with a tiny cape for Halloween.
meanings.sent4: The artist mantlingsed the statue with flowing ribbons to symbolize freedom.
meanings.sent5: The decorator mantlingsed the walls with rich tapestries to create a cozy atmosphere.
